title: 110_hr6217
content: SECTION 1. MODIFIED PROCEDURES. Before closing or consolidating a post office, the Postal Service must investigate the need for the closure and provide notice to those affected. The community impact is a key consideration in the decision-making process. The Postal Service must investigate the impact of closing or consolidating a post office on the community, employees, and government policy. Compliance with the Occupational Safety and Health Act of 1970 is not a consideration. A decision to proceed with closure or consolidation must follow an investigation. The Postal Service must investigate the impact of closing or consolidating a post office on the community, employees, and government policy. A decision to close or consolidate a post office must be made in writing and include findings on specified considerations. Notice of the decision and findings must be posted in the affected post office and mailed to all served persons at least 90 days before a final determination is made, allowing for comments. The notice must include a proposal to close or consolidate the post office and instructions for submitting comments. The final determination to close or consolidate a post office must be made in writing after considering any comments received during a 90-day period. The Postal Service cannot take action before posting the final determination in each affected post office and sending notice to all served persons, including information on appeal rights. Amendment to Section 404(d)(5) of title 39, United States Code mandates suspension pending appeal. An exception is made for emergency suspensions or closures due to lease termination by a party other than the Postal Service. Section 404 of title 39, United States Code is amended to include definitions related to post offices, postal patrons, residents within ZIP codes served, and relevant local government officials.
